results.title: Atoll life in Kiribati
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Cinema Enterprises and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
This series of films examines traditional lifestyles on the different Pacific islands. This particular film looks at the traditions observed by the 64,000 people who live on the sixteen islands of Kiribati.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Oliver Howes, Cinema Enterprises and Film Australia

results.title: The Human face of the Pacific
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, Oliver Howes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A series of six documentaries covering six Pacific nations and territories, giving a wide-ranging view of contemporary Pacific society. It shows the variety of ways of life from subsistence to urbanization and the challenges from outside of what has been called the “Pacific way”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis O’Rourke, Oliver Howes and Film Australia

results.title: En roulant ma boule. A la claire fontaine.
results.creator_credit: Jim MacKay, Laurence Hyde, Cine-Photographie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Chants populaires”.
Animated scenes illustrate two French folk songs. ‘En roulant ma boule’ 2.50 mins. ‘A la claire fontaine’ 1.39 mins. Featuring the Alouette Quartet.

results.title: C'est l'aviron
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chants populaires”.
A short animated version of a French folk song. McLaren used gouache drawings which he superimposed against a scenic background to give the impression of a boat travelling along a lake and river which he acheived by zooming during the photographic process.

results.title: La-haut sur ces montagnes. C'est l'aviron.
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chants populaires”.
Animated interpretation of two French folk songs. Featuring Madeleine Lachance and the Quatuor Alouette. ‘La-haut sur ces montagnes’ (2.59 mins) is set on the island of Orleans near Quebec, where traditional dances and folksongs are kept alive by the peasant community. In ‘C’est l’aviron’ (3.15 mins) McLaren used gouache drawings which he superimposed against a scenic background to give the impression of a boat travelling along a lake and river which he acheived by zooming during the photographic process.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Palardy, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Rebecca
results.creator_credit: Jim O'Brien, Hilary Heath and Carlton U K Television
results.brief_description: Daphne du Maurier’s classic story of love, jealousy and secrets is revamped here with a British cast that includes Charles Dance, Faye Dunaway and Diana Rigg. Emilia Fox plays the modest and shy young woman, who meets, falls in love with, and eventually marries Maxim de Winter, a widower on vacation. When the new Mrs de Winter arrives at Maxim’s mansion, Manderley, she finds a house of hostile servants, most notably the housekeeper who works with sinister cunning to keep alive the influence of her late mistress, Rebecca.

results.title: Fight or flight : overcoming panic and agoraphobia
results.creator_credit: Christine Manson, Christopher Thomas and Monkey See Productions
results.brief_description: This video provides helpful advice to sufferers of panic attacks and agoraphobia. We follow two people as they discuss the debilitating effect panic attacks and agoraphobia have had over their lives. They outline symptoms such as feeling that something was physically wrong and the successful techniques they have used to overcome the disorder. The techniques are based on cognitive behavioural therapy, which has proven to be most successful in treating such cases and is taught by Professor Ron Rapee, professor of psychology, Macquarie University, and Dr Lisa Lampe, a consultant psychiatrist who specialises in anxiety disorders. This program is designed for people with panic disorders and agoraphobia, their family and friends and health professionals. It looks at fundamental questions such as what is a panic disorder, what is agoraphobia, what is cognitive behavioural therapy? As well as the role that medication and self help groups can offer to the difficult and often misunderstood condition.

results.title: Fidelio
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather and Southern Television Corporation Pty Limited
results.brief_description: Glyndebourne Festival Opera 1979 production of Beethoven’s “Fidelio” with words by J.N. Bouilly, J.F. Sonnleithner and F. Treitschke, produced by Peter Hall with the London Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Bernard Haitink and the Glyndebourne Chorus. Set in a Spanish prison, the opera tells of a wife, Leonore (Elisabeth Soderstrom), who, disguised as a man (Fidelio), enters the prison to free her husband, the prisoner, Florestan (Anton de Ridder). Cast also includes Ian Caley (Jaquino), Elizabeth Gale (Marzelline), Curt Appelgren (Rocco), Robert Allman (Don Pizarro) and Michael Langdon (Don Fernando). Sung in German with English subtitles.

results.title: Reasons for caring
results.creator_credit: Craig Johnson and National Fire Protection Association (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Following an explosion in an operating theatre, various people comment on the possibilities of fire in a hospital, the precautions to take and the potential for tragedy if a fire does occur. No matter why a fire starts, staff should know exactly what to do and where equipment is stored.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Craig Johnson and National Fire Protection Association (U.S.)
